name: Introduction to Visual Culture and Theory
description: This course provides an introduction to the field of Visual Culture and Theory. It covers topics such as the history of art, visual culture, art criticism, and the role of the viewer. Students will learn how to interpret, analyze, and evaluate visual artworks in the context of the larger field of Art History.

name: Theories of Visual Culture and Theory
description: This course explores the various theories of Visual Culture and Theory. Students will learn about the theoretical frameworks, concepts, and debates within the field. Topics include semiotics, iconography, phenomenology, structuralism, postmodernism, and more.
prerequisites: Introduction to Visual Culture and Theory

name: History of Visual Culture and Theory
description: This course looks at the history of Visual Culture and Theory. It covers the development of the field from ancient times to the present, including the impact of various schools of thought and major figures in the field.
prerequisites: Introduction to Visual Culture and Theory
Theories of Visual Culture and Theory

name: Advanced Topics in Visual Culture and Theory
description: This course covers a range of advanced topics in Visual Culture and Theory. Topics include contemporary debates, new media, digital culture, the influence of technology, and more.
prerequisites: Introduction to Visual Culture and Theory
Theories of Visual Culture and Theory
History of Visual Culture and Theory
